intro: Hippocratea volubilis var. caribaea, commonly known as the Caribaea nightshade, is a climbing shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes plants like tomatoes and potatoes, and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by berries containing toxic seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
